Article.Naam: The Medicines Control Council and its Applicability to Health-Care Professionals

Question.Question: 1: The Medicines Act gives prescription rights to medical practitioners and dentists for schedule 2 to 6 medicines
2: Schedule 5 analgesics can only be repeated every six months if a psychiatrist has been consulted before the six-month repeat is issued.
3: Health-care professionals, specifically those in aesthetic medicine, may advertise all products they use in the interest of the public.
4: No medicine may be provided or received as a sample in South Africa.
5: Not adhering to the Medicines Act could constitute a criminal offence in certain instances.
